bib.title: Production of monoenergetic MeV-range neutrons by 3H(p,n)3He reaction

free_txt: Ion Beam Application Group, Korea Institute of
Geoscience and Mineral Resources, Daejon,305-350, Korea
KIGAM 1.7 MV tandem accelerator with
the source of negative ion by cesium sputtering (SNICS)
The pulse-height spectrum and the pulse-shape
spectrum of the produced neutron were measured by
2"x2" BC-501 liquid scintillation detector.
Other BC-501 liquid scintillation detector is used as
a neutron monitor.
A 2"x2" HP Ge detector was used as a detector
of gamma-rays.
statistical errors of gamma-counts from samples
and neutron-counts of BC-501 detectors
and also systematic errors in the counting efficiency
for HP Ge detector and the uncertainty of areal
density of samples were considered in calculating
neutron capture cross section and neutron total cross
section.
KIGAM 1.7 MV tandem accelerator with
the source of negative ion by cesium sputtering (SNICS)
The Ti-3H thin film target of this experiment
was provided by a company (SODERN) in France. The
substrate of this target was Cu with a thickness of
1.2 mm. The first layer was Ti with an areal density
between 200 mu-g/cm2 (2.5.10**18 atoms/cm2) and 300
mu-g/cm2 (3.8.10**18 atoms/cm2). Ti was impregnated
with tritium of 4.6.10**18 atoms/cm2.
The control of the beam energy and the stability for
terminal voltage was performed by the resonance of
991+-1 keV in 27Al(p,gamma) and that of 3047+-1 keV
in 16O(alpha,alpha).
The flux in the beam direction was
determined to be 3.76x10**7 n/s/sr. The neutron flux
was  measured by fast neutron activation using Au
sample, with purity of 99.99%, a metal disk with a
diameter of 5 cm and a thickness of 0.3 cm.
The shape of Fe sample with a purity of 98% was a
disk with a diameter of 5 cm and a thickness of 0.3 cm.
Data were received from Dr. G.D.Kim
Entry approved by Dr. G.D.Kim
